short_summary: The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) requires a Contractor to provide monitoring services
description: The department requires a contractor to provide monitoring services to provide project decision-makers and other stakeholders with consistent, reliable information and advice on the projects’ progress, help partners make corrective adjustments as needed and achieve better development results. An integral part of the services to be provided as a result of this contract is to provide a platform for communication and sharing of lessons learned and best practices to ultimately improve health programming in Tanzania. These services provided under the contract are also a means of managing the risks associated with the significant size and complexity of these projects and helping partners coordinate their efforts with complementary projects in the sector The monitoring services required include performance measurement (collection of actual data on indicators); review of that information to assess if the project/program is on track and to identify problems, challenges, and/or gaps; and make recommendations for adjustment. Monitoring also includes the provision of ‘real-time’ information about the use of resources, and the progress made in achieving outputs and outcomes. With the support of monitoring tools, the monitor will apply the following general monitoring concepts: 1.Continued follow-up of project activities 2.Operational structures 3.Efficacy and efficiency of implementing organisation 4.Collaboration, coordination and communication between implementing organizations and stakeholders, and funders 5.Data collection and analysis 6.Target setting 7.Use of indicators to monitor progress 8.Monitoring of risks 9.Dissemination of findings/reporting  Two cross-cutting themes are integrated into all of Canada’s international development programs and policies: increasing environmental sustainability and advancing gender equality. In line with DFATD’s Environment Legislative and Policy Framework, the Contractor will explicitly and systematically integrate environmental considerations at all stages of the initiative, where relevant. DFATD Environment Specialists should also systematically be consulted. In all planning and reporting activities, the Contractor will consider the application of the above provisions. In line with DFATD’s policy on gender equality, the Contractor will explicitly and systematically integrate gender equality considerations at all stages of the initiative, where relevant. DFATD Gender Equality Specialists should also systematically be consulted. In all planning and reporting activities, the Contractor will consider the application of the above provisions

### Title - RFP for Project Monitor Services

#### Project Overview

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) is seeking a contractor to provide project monitoring services for a project located in Tanzania. The contractor will be responsible for monitoring the project's progress, providing reliable information and advice to decision-makers and stakeholders, and helping partners make necessary adjustments to achieve better development results.

#### Key Monitoring Objectives and Activities

The project monitor will be responsible for:

*   Collecting and analyzing data on project indicators
*   Reviewing project performance to identify problems, challenges, and opportunities for improvement
*   Providing recommendations for adjustments to ensure project success
*   Disseminating findings and reporting on project progress
*   Integrating environmental and gender equality considerations into all aspects of the project

#### Requirements

The successful contractor will have:

*   Experience in project monitoring and evaluation
*   Strong analytical and analytical skills
*   Ability to apply environmental and gender equality considerations in project planning and reporting

#### Contract Details

*   Contract start and end dates: Not specified
*   Tender closing date: August 22, 2023, 2:00 PM EST
*   Tender status: Expired
*   Regions of opportunity: National Capital Region (NCR) and Tanzania
*   Regions of delivery: Tanzania and NCR

#### Relevant Attachment

Please refer to the attached tender notice for detailed information on the requirements and instructions for submitting a proposal.

[Link to attachment](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/7464/23-229532---npp---eng---project-monitor---foreign-affairs%2C-trade-and-development.pdf)
